page.title: 04Protecting Hexton Farmland
page.content: Pigeons and other wild_life cause farmers a great deal of trouble so they use a scarer that sounds like a gun. Scaring starts at 0530 when the sun rises and stops at 2030 when it sets. Sometimes the farmer builds a hut with straw bales. We went in one. It was very cosy indeed. The farmer hides in the hut and shoots at birds which attack his crops. We climbed on top of the hut but as soon as I stood up it caved in. Fortunately the hut was soon rebuilt. To stop rabbits getting into the crops and to keep the sheep out there are a number of fences made of wood and wire mesh. A new one recently cost Â£10,000 and was erected by the Council who look after the Nature Reserves to prevent wild_life attacking the crops.
